crunch.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a noise like the sound of something being crushed
crunch.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The only sound was the crunch of tyres on gravel.
crunch.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a difficult situation caused by a lack of something, especially money or time
crunch.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Three new teachers were hired to help ease the crunch.
Cost cutting had enabled the organization to survive a previous cash crunch.
crunch.translation[0].definitions[2].def: an exercise in which you lie on your back and lift your head and shoulders off the ground to make your stomach muscles strong
crunch.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make a sound like something being crushed
crunch.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Their boots crunched loudly on the frozen snow.
crunch.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to eat hard food in a way that makes a noise
crunch.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The dog was crunching on a bone.
crunch.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to do very complicated calculations on large amounts of DATA (=information stored on a computer) in order to find out about something
crunch.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Media buyers have to know whatâ€™s going on, not just how to crunch numbers.
